ses:header.ses:name: accept
ses:header.ses:value: image/gif, image/x-xbitmap, image/jpeg, image/pjpeg, application/vnd.ms-excel, application/vnd.ms-powerpoint, application/msword, application/x-shockwave-flash, */*

ses:response.ses:responseBody:
Format Error Reporting

There are two sets of test, the first verify errors in the FormatDate tag.
The second verify that error reporting works against the HTML tags. For each HTML tag that allows a formatter, verify that the error is being reported. Each of these should produce an in-line error and also an error in the collected errors at the end of the page.
This is a single page test.

  • [Tag Error:1, Found in tag FormatDate] -- No Parent
  • [Tag Error:2, Found in tag Label] -- bad input pattern
  • [Tag Error:3, Found in tag Label] -- bad pattern
  • [Tag Error:4, Found in tag Label] -- bad date
  • [Tag Error:5, Found in tag Label] -- bad type
  • [Tag Error:6, Found in tag FormatDate]01/28/63
  • [Tag Error:7, Found in tag FormatDate]
  • [Tag Error:8, Found in tag FormatDate]
  • [Tag Error:9, Found in tag FormatDate]
Page Errors
Error NumberTag TypeError
1FormatDateMessageFormat tags require a parent that is Formattable.
2LabelMessageFormatDate error, the stringInputPattern "x//ssd" is invalid. IllegalArgumentException: Illegal pattern character 'x'
3LabelMessageFormatDate error creating SimpleDateFormat: Illegal pattern character 'x'
4LabelMessageThe String "bad-date" is not in an understood date format.
5LabelMessageThe type "java.lang.Character" may not be formatted by a formatDate tag.
6FormatDateMessageAttribute 'patttern' is required to have a value. The value "" is illegal. This is often caused by binding to an object with a null value.
7FormatDateMessageAttribute 'patttern' is required to have a value. The value "" is illegal. This is often caused by binding to an object with a null value.
8FormatDateMessageAttribute 'patttern' is required to have a value. The value "" is illegal. This is often caused by binding to an object with a null value.
9FormatDateMessageAttribute 'patttern' is required to have a value. The value "" is illegal. This is often caused by binding to an object with a null value.
